DataElement.preferredName: Patient Negation Ability Discontinue Intervention or Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria  Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine clinical trial participation for questions related weather the patient is able to discontinue a procedure to treat disease as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Negation Ability Discontinue Intervention or Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Negation Ability Discontinue Intervention or Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.:To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient unable to disconti
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue medications or substances that are potent inhibitors, inducers or sensitive substrates of CYP3A4/5 or CYP2C19 prior to study treatment within the timelines noted in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue the use of a potent CYP2C9 inhibitor/inducer(s)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue medications or substances that are potent inhibitors, inducers or sensitive substrates of CYP3A4/5 or CYP2C19 prior to starting M3814 and avelumab on day 7?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant proton-pump inhibitors (PPIs) or H2 receptor antagonists (H2 blockers)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require chronic concomitant treatment of strong CYP450 3A4 inhibitors and inducers who cannot discontinue it before treatment with etoposide?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant medications or herbal supplements that are strong inhibitors or strong inducers of cytochrome P450 (CYP) isoenzymes CYP3A4/5, CYP2C9, and CYP2C19 within the timelines noted in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant proton-pump inhibitors (PPIs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient requires concomitant use of strong CYP3A4 inhibitors/inducers, are they unable to come off 3 eliminated half-lives of moderate CYP3A4 inhibitors and 5 eliminated half-lives of strong CYP3A4 inhibitors?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue drugs that are hMATE1 or hMATE2-K substrates?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue drug transport and aldehyde oxidase inhibitors for at least 4 weeks prior to initiating Lutetium Lu 177 dotatate?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue medications or substances that are potent inhibitors, inducers or sensitive substrates of CYP3A4/5 or CYP2C19 prior to starting M3814 and avelumab?
